properties.name: 1 Bedroom Party Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Gfbirch This is where I moved after I got my current job. I lived with a couple of people for a bit but when I decided I wanted to live on my own, this is where I went. I lost a wife, deposit, and many friends here. But many fond memories of "Kings Cup", "The Godfather", and SG events still stain the surroundings.

properties.description: Posted by GfbirchLawton OKThis is where my squad bay was when I was attached to Fort Sill, OK. This was where I went to school to be an artillereyman.

properties.description: Posted by GfbirchI was never there. I had a lot of friends when I moved to Sparks and I always wanted to stay with them. Mom was away half the time and the apartment was small. This was also the house where my mom reported me as a runaway, when I wasnt.

properties.name: Dad's Home

properties.name: Danes House where I rented a room for a few months.
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is where I stayed after a stranger gave me keys to his house and said "Make yourself at home, brother." Dane let me rent a room for about 6 months, until he changed his lifestyle. He went from, "Due Im bringing that one hot chick over tonight so turn your radio up, unless you like to hear that kinda stuff.". To "Sorry the kids came into your room. So it was about time for me to move on. Thanks brother.

properties.name: Digiovanna Crib
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchWhen my mom kicked me out for bringing him over I stayed with him for a while. I needed a place to live and he let me sneek in and stay every now and then, without his mom knowing. Thanks Chuckie!

properties.name: Dixie Hell
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was where I finally ended up after I was imancipated. My girlfreinds parents (Eventually wife #1) let me move in. Unfortunatelly Cassandra wanted to stay in the same room and this is where she claimed to get knocked up by me. On a side note, she tried killing me here, he he.

properties.name: Dominoes Pizza
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchIn my first two years living in the neighborhood, I spent OVER FIVE GRAND on pizza\'s...... had many party\'s, what can i say.

properties.name: First REAL and STILL Best kiss ever!
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is where Kristen and I hung out and she ACTED drunk to make out with me. We started on the 50 yard line and ended up here. I still remember the taste, and I have been trying to find the candy she ate ever since.

properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is where we moved after a shortcomming in 9th grade. This is where I started my movie fetish. Mike and Gene bought damn near every movie that came out, and I got to watch em! This was also the place where the child molester lived next door. And my best friends who lioved there (not really) always wanted me to come over and stay the night!

properties.name: Greenbre Theaters .50!!!!!

properties.name: Grove Street Apartment (7th Grade)
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was where we moved when we first moved to Reno. We came here on vacation and I picked some numbers at breakfast and my mom won 40 bucks. A few weeks later we moved right down the street, and the famous gambling began. We later moved to South Reno after a kid pulled a gun on me at school on my first day.

properties.name: HQ 1ST BN 11th MAR
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was where I moved after I caught Cassandr (wife #1) with everyone. I stayed in two room right next to each other. One when I was a Lance Corporal, and the other when I got promoted to Corporal. This is also where I stayed when I was dating Maranda (wife #2). And she was active duty navy, so she hated sleeping on ship. So everynight she would drive and hours up from San Diego and sleep in my twin bed with me. It was fun hiding her when inspections hit. But when you are the one giving most of them, IT DOESNT MATTER!

properties.name: Happy Chef
properties.description: Posted by Gfbirch

properties.name: Hiding spot
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is where friends and I would hide and shoot busses and other things with paintballs. Fun, Fun, Fun

properties.name: High School Clubhouse
properties.description: Posted by Gfbirch This was a clubhouse at this resort where we would break into during the winter and hang out. We would play pool, watch TV, and the best thing, Sit in the spa/ sauna. We hung out here and made friends with the guard and we never hurt anything. This was heaven for high school times. This was where many girls came with us. And this is where I saw very many "FIRST\'s".

properties.name: Howards
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was a strange hotel / studio place we lived that literally had one room with a sink. We lived here for a while to save money and eventually moved down the street.

properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is my favorite restaraunt. Theres one here and in Ontario. This one has the better food but its a little older. The new one in Ontario has an easier atmosphere.

A late night of drinking brought me back to her apartment with her roommate and friends. Nomee came back from work wondering why all these people were there and I just knew it. Good times and bad. Im glad I went there in the first place.

properties.name: Nugget Roof

The only thing it did was draw us apart more. The stink of this place after I came back and got my stuff from up north will remain in my head for the rest of my life.

properties.name: PMS Apartment
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was our second home in Reno after we had to hastely move from the previous school. I transfered to Pine Middle School which was across the street and this was where the gambling hit hardest. This is where I think I lost the most and where we gained the most due to ma gambling. Its also where I saw the OJ chase.

properties.name: Parking Spot
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is where Cassandra and I used to park for HOURS and just chat and listen to music. We hated our homes and this was pretty private to just hang out.

properties.name: Parking Spot of Bad News
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is the parking spot where Cassandra and her mom told me she was pregnant and THEY are having THEIR baby even if I dont want to. (And later I found out wasnt mine!)

properties.name: Pawn Shop
properties.description: Posted by Gfbirch This place has most of my childhood electronics that were ever worth anything. Its also where I saw my first M! GARAND with USMC plates, very motivating.

properties.name: Phelippe's
properties.description: Posted by Saravc 1001 N. Alameda St. Los Angeles CA. 90012 Philippe The Original is one of the oldest and best known restaurants in Southern California. Philippe\'s was established in 1908 by Philippe Mathieu, who claimed the distinction of having created the "French Dipped Sandwich." One day in 1918, while making a sandwich, Mathieu inadvertently dropped the sliced french roll into the roasting pan filled with juice still hot from the oven. The patron, a policeman, said he would take the sandwich anyway and returned the next day with some friends asking for more dipped sandwiches. And so was born the "French Dipped Sandwich," so called either because of Mathieu\'s French heritage, the French roll the sandwich is made on or because the officer\'s name was French. The answer is lost to history. Harry, Dave and Frank Martin were in the business of renting horses and wagons from their Jewel stables when they purchased Philippe\'s from Mathieu in 1927 for around 000. They operated the restaurant 24 hours a day, 7 days a week until World War II. The business grew steadily through the depression of 1929 and World War II mainly by virtue of the dedication and perseverance to duty of these hardy Kansans. Philippe\'s was forced to move to make way for the then new Hollywood-Santa Ana 101 freeway, and in 1951 relocated to the present location, which was a machine shop with a hotel on the second floor. Change does not come rapidly at Philippe\'s, so most of what we are today is very much what we were and did years ago. We like to say that only the prices have changed. Philippe\'s "French Dipped Sandwich" is the specialty of the house and consists of either roast beef, roast pork, leg of lamb, turkey or ham served on a lightly textured, freshly baked French roll which has been dipped in the natural gravy of the roasts. Swiss, American, Monterey Jack or Blue cheese may be added. To accompany your sandwich we offer a tart, tangy cole slaw, homemade potato and macaroni salads, hard boiled eggs pickled in beet juice and spices, large Kosher style, sour dill or sweet pickles, black olives and hot yellow chili peppers. Philippe\'s still prepares and serves close to 300 pounds of pigs feet every week. We prepare about 40 gallons of our own hot mustard twice weekly. It is best used sparingly as it is a truly very hot french mustard. However, used with discretion, it compliments the sandwich to perfection. It may be purchased by the jar at the front candy counter. Delicious beef stew is prepared daily made from choice beef and fresh vegetables; two soup selections are offered each day, as well as our chili and beans. Lemonade, iced tea, milk, mineral and seltzer waters, and a variety of soft drinks are served. Domestic and imported beers, our house wines and several premium wines by the glass and bottle are offered. To top off your meal at Philippe\'s, try one of our desserts. A large variety of cream and fruit pies are offered daily. In addition, we have ice cream, New York style cheese cake, our baked apples, custard, tapioca, and fresh fruit. Hearty breakfasts are served from 6:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. daily. Some of our breakfast items include eggs (any style), bacon, sausage, ham, corned beef hash and our own fried potatoes. Ask for our fresh. homemade salsa for the egg dishes. In addition, omelets, cinnamon French toast, pancakes, and a variety of fruits and juices are offered. Coffee is included with most breakfasts. Featured are our biscuits, cinnamon streusel coffee cake, cinnamon rolls donuts and muffins, all baked in-house. The price of a cup of coffee remained a nickel until 1977, when it was increased 100%, to a dime. The way the service works is unique. There is a long display counter with 10 servers, (we call them "Carvers"), many of which have been working at Philippe\'s well over 20 years. Each Carver has everything she needs to prepare your meal. You get into one of the 10 lines, and when you reach your Carver, she can take care of your whole meal; make your sandwich or fix your hot dish, serve salads or soup, give you coffee or a glass of wine, add it all up and take your money. The plates are paper, the service is fast. There are ceiling fans, neon soft drink and beer signs, sawdust on the floor, a few booths and long wooden tables with stools. Seating is family style. It is not unusual to sit with people from all walks of life at the same table. There are press clippings and civic citations on the walls, and you can weigh yourself on the same scale that was used by Norman Rockwell for the Saturday Evening Post. You can make yourself at home. In 1951, when Philippe\'s closed its doors on Aliso Street, Matt Weinstock, then a reporter for the Los Angeles Daily News wrote ". . . Philippe\'s was something special. It had sawdust on the floor and cracks in the wall but you didn\'t care. You went there for the luscious French-dipped sandwich, the boiled eggs, the hot mustard, the potato salad, the cole slaw, the immense hunks of pie, the always hot mugs of coffee. You also woke up at night, maybe thousands of miles away, yearning for one of those sandwiches." More than 35 years later, Merrill Shindler of the Los Angeles Herald Examiner wrote, ". . . Philippe\'s is more than food. It\'s one of those marvelous phenomenon\'s I find myself constantly drawn to in an effort to connect with a bit of L.A.\'s too often ignored past. . . What can I say? It\'s Philippe\'s. It\'s the Original--and it always will be." And finally, MacDonald Harris of the New York Times ("Real food in L.A.," March 1990) wrote, "There is an air of camaraderie among the customers, a kind of unspoken friendliness and consideration that\'s rare in a big city . . . The customers are people of all kinds: shoppers, residents of nearby Chinatown, businessmen, Amtrak workers from the station, people who have been coming here for years and are now bringing their children. More than any other place I can think of, Philippe\'s typifies the democratic spirit of Los Angeles . . ." Philippe\'s 213-628-3781 213-628-1812 fax www.philippes.com 1001 North Alameda Street Los Angeles, California 90012 Philippe\'s is open from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily except Thanksgiving and Christmas. Free parking is provided for customers while patronizing the restaurant. Philippe\'s is located one block north of the Union Depot Train Station, Metro Rail Station, and Olvera Street. It is located on the fringe of Chinatown, within one mile of Dodger Stadium at the intersection of North Main, Alameda and Ord Streets.

properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was where I had started my journey to becomming a man. Unfortunately I was a liar and after a month of living in this squad bay I was dropped for integrety violation and sent across the way.

The cop saw my USMC sticker in my window and said if I could do 105 push ups he would let me go with a warning. I did them all after he yelded at me for not hiding behind his car. He didnt want to get in trouble for hazing.

properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is the apartment Cassandra (wife #1), Geoffrey, and I moved when we got out of the off base kick. It wasnt a bad place, just everyone knew you were there. It was the troop housing so all of the horney Marines and their wives were always on the prowl. I caught Cassandra sleeping with my best friend not to mention half of 3rd BN 1st Marines. This is where I left her, and this is where she left me..... with thousands of dollars of damage. Oh yeah did I mention Josh Gracin lived in Serra Mesa too? What a DORK, but I gotta admit, Im a fan.

This is where I found out the results of the paternity test, and this is where Maranda and I lived after getting married. It was the coolest home in the best neighborhood. I have very fond memories there and will never forget the strange shape of the living room .

It was a cozy studio with the perfect affordable price. I found it, reserved it, and paid for it all over the phone prior to seeing it just to rescue my 1st wife from the place she was living back home. And surprisingly it was perfect. Perfectly small that is.

properties.name: The Phat , Fat, new life house.
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis is where Maranda (wife #2), Geoffrey, and I moved to after I got out of the Marines. Although I had found out Geoffrey wasnt paternally mine, I thought I would try to get it it work. But I couldnt. I had gained a lot of weight and Maranda and I lost a child she was carrying. My mom moved in for a VERY SHORT time and this was probablly one of my favorite places to live. Other then the bad events it was perfect, I mean you cant hate a place that is across the street from MCRD or Marine Corps Recruit Depot San Diego, the place where I was truely born.

Never took it serious and at the end of the night we would put all the left over food on one burger and see who could eat it for money. One day when everyone was off and I was working I just walked off the job, mid-order and quit. Hey everyone was going out without me.....

properties.name: What Youll Do For A Job.
properties.description: Posted by GfbirchThis was my first home once I moved to the Inland Empire. When I first got my job I was married and couldnt afford rent for her and a place to live, so I lived here. Yes thats a tree, and I slept in my car day and night for two months straight before a stranger gave me keys to his house in Yuciapa and let me rent a room cheap.
